topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
Here's a potentially interesting and at the same time dumb question:  Is anime and otaku culture slowly taking over western media?


I don't mean that as in it's popularity will continue to climb, it seems to have leveled out lately, or that otakus are going to invade the usa with hentai :V; I am also aware that many people grow out of eastern otaku culture or they are no longer fans.  Rather for the sake of the argument let's imagine the usa and such culturally as a very large fish bowl with a lot of water to the point that if the tank broke there would go your house insurance; now let's imagine new things introduced to a culture as food dye.  Every time you drop a drop into the water it ever so slightly changes the color to the water overall.  Now imagine continuously dripping anime food dye into the bowl; while a drop every second or so doesn't seem like a lot eventually the color of the fish tank will start changing.  What I mean by this is that is otaku culture eventually going to be saturated into western culture to the point that it has a visible effect?
